result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MARK R PRIEVE

defendant.name: PRIEVE, MARK R
defendant.address: E9999 COUNTY ROAD M, ELK MOUND, WI 54739

records.addlTxt:
9:33 AM Defendant MARK R PRIEVE in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for MARK R PRIEVE.  Attorney Sara Matthews in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF504. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 

Attorney Miller enters not guilty pleas on all counts in 22CF128.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Court orders defendant to sign bond at the Clerk of Court's Office.

BOND COVERS 22CF504 & 22CF128
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant shall not drive with any alcohol / illegal drugs in system.
Daily PBTs at CHSO: or enroll and actively participate in IDIP: or Soberlink device.

11:00 AM Defendant MARK R PRIEVE in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for MARK R PRIEVE.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court states case and notes appearances. 
State witness Deputy N. Maurice sworn & questioned by ADA Matthews. 
Record reflects identification of defendant. 
Exhibit 1 offered & received. 
Witness cross-examined by Attorney Miller. 
Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
Attorney Miller addresses bond requirement and medical condition that contributes to difficulty in testing.
Pre-trial specialist outlines different options for testing. 
Court requests documentation prior to modifying bond.
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MARK R PRIEVE in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for MARK R PRIEVE. 
Defendant unable to hire private counsel.
Preliminary hearing to be scheduled with the JA. 
Bond continued.

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MARK R PRIEVE in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for MARK R PRIEVE. 
Defendant still trying to obtain private counsel.
Bond continued, reminded to maintain compliance with pre-trial monitoring.
Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MARK R PRIEVE in court.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for MARK R PRIEVE. 
Defendant has received a copy of Complaint and acknowledges maximum penalties. 
Defendant requests adjournment to obtain private counsel. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
